data.event: Clifton was founded in the winter of 1852-1853, when the families of Frank Kell, Joseph A. Kemp, Samuel and Monroe Locker, and T. A. McSpadden settled in the vicinity.
Over the years the name was altered to Clifton.
The post office was established in 1859.
The First Presbyterian Church of Clifton was organized in 1861 and is the oldest church in continuous service in the county.
In 1868, this mill was replaced by a limestone mill, which was eventually converted to the electric power plant that provided the first electricity for Clifton homes and businesses.
A three-story school known as Rock School was built about 1870 and served the community for more than twenty years.

event.title: served the community for more than twenty years

data.event: A three-story school known as Rock School was built about 1870 and served the community for more than twenty years.
In 1893, a new building was constructed on property donated to the Clifton school system.
